alert.note: Alert for Clay; Quitman; Randolph (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 2:13PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Dale, central Henry, northeastern Coffee, Clay, southwestern Randolph and southwestern Quitman Counties through 300 PM EDT/200 PM CDT/... At 212 PM EDT/112 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Georgetown to Texasville to near Banks. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Ariton, Bellville, Shorterville, Watson Crossroads, Scottsboro Crossroads, Ricks Place, Pecan, Roeton, Thomas Mill Creek, Phillips Crossroads, Bethel, Hwy 231 Pea River Bridge, Suttons Corner, Fort Gaines-Clay Airport, Skipperville, Moores Crossroads, Garnersville and Murphy Station. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
